title: Planned Parenthood Rejects Trump Offer To End Abortions, Keep Funding
text:
Planned Parenthood Rejects Trump Offer To End Abortions, Keep Funding "I am pro-life and I am deeply committed ..." by Jack Davis March 7, 2017 at 6:55am Share on Facebook 389 Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
President Donald Trump has offered Planned Parenthood a deal in which the mammoth abortion provider would continue to receive federal funds on one condition — that it stop performing abortions. The White House told Planned Parenthood its federal funding could stay if abortions go. The group refused. https://t.co/dCSvSYOBXL 
— The New York Times (@nytimes) March 7, 2017 
The answer was a swift and firm rejection of Trump’s offer, which was first reported by the New York Times and later confirmed by the White House. Advertisement - story continues below Anthony Shaffer: Allegations Of Obama Wiretapping Represent ‘Soviet-Dictator Level Wrongdoing’ 
“As I said throughout the campaign, I am pro-life and I am deeply committed to investing in women’s health and plan to significantly increase federal funding in support of nonabortion services such as cancer screenings,” Trump said in a statement. 
“Polling shows the majority of Americans oppose public funding for abortion, even those who identify as pro-choice. There is an opportunity for organizations to continue the important work they do in support of women’s health, while not providing abortion services,” read Trump’s statement. 
Planned Parenthood Federation of America President Cecile Richards says the group “will always stand for women’s ability to make decisions about their health and lives, without interference from politicians.” Advertisement - story continues below 
The offer was revealed shortly after the release of the initial draft of a proposal by House Republicans for a new healthcare system to replace Obamacare. The legislation calls for stripping all federal funds from Planned Parenthood. 
The New York Times reported that Planned Parenthood officials said they were offered the possibility of an increase in federal funds if abortion work ended. 
The Times suggested that the olive branch to Planned Parenthood was due to the behind-the-scenes influence of Ivanka Trump. 
Although Trump campaigned against abortion, he noted during the campaign that he was not entirely opposed to Planed Parenthood Advertisement - story continues below
